definition: to put into (one's pockets, clothes)/Taiwan pr. [chuai3]

sentences.english: I guessed that the Stapletons were the pair.
sentences.chinese: 我揣测到斯台普顿兄妹就是要找的那对。

sentences.english: You’ve got such promise, yet you’re  squandering it on  malice.
sentences.chinese: 你很有前途，可是你却将之浪费在恶意揣测上。

sentences.english: How can we learn not to do this?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何才能学到不枉自揣测呢？

sentences.english: So presumably this, too, is a pun.
sentences.chinese: 因此据我揣测这也是一个双关语。

sentences.english: You know how many speculations started after that?
sentences.chinese: 妳知道那引起了多少揣测吗？

sentences.english: Lisa's condition brings about numerous speculations.
sentences.chinese: 丽莎的病带来许多揣测。

sentences.english: They're unpredictable to the very god who created them.
I suspect that secretly, she looks like Beyonce.
sentences.chinese: 我私下里揣测，她看起来像碧昂丝的。

sentences.english: He had pondered it all night long.
sentences.chinese: 他在这些问题上揣测了一整夜。

definition: to analyze/to try to figure out/to try to fathom
to pry into or spy on/to snoop/to peep/to poke one's nose into/to peer/to get a glimpse of
to speculate/to surmise/to wonder whether/to guess
to doubt (sth)/to be skeptical of/to have one's doubts/to harbor suspicions/to suspect that
to comment/to talk about/to discuss/discussion/CL:個|个[ge4]
to jump to an unfounded conclusion
